name: 經濟地質學
comment: 中階以上課程，適合大三以上學生修習，以作為探究研究所之先修課程，同時也開放碩士班無此課程基礎之學生選修。
restrict: ◎限大三大四 ◎限碩一碩二碩三以上修習
description: This course will be an introduction to mineral resources, their classification, genesis and distribution in time and space. Important global resources will be examined and discussed through independent term projects. Topics will focus the different processes which specific ore-deposits form. The course is structured into four parts which cover the majority of ore-deposits on Earth. The first part will focus on magmatic-related ore-deposits. The second part will discuss hydrothermal-related ore-deposits. The third part will focus on sedimentary-related ore-deposits. The final part will contextualize ore-deposits into a greater global tectonic framework.
goals: To familiarize the students to mineral deposits
To introduce to the students the different types of mineral deposits.
To show the students the relationship between commodity prices and economic development
syllabus:
_Week 1_   Introduction to Economic Geology

_Week 2_   Igneous Ore-forming Processes

_Week 3_   Mineralization within Mafic Magmas and Layered Intrusions

_Week 4_   Magmatic-hydrothermal Ore\-forming Processes

_Week 5_   Granite-related ore-forming Processes

_Week 6_   Hydrothermal Ore-forming Processes

**_Week 7_** **Mid-term exam**

_Week 8_   VMS and SEDEX deposits

_Week 9_   Surficial and Supergene Ore-forming Processes

_Week 10_ Laterite deposits

_Week 11_ Sedimentary Ore-forming Processes

_Week 12_ Banded-iron formations and Placer Deposits

_Week 13 Ore Deposits in a Global Tectonic Context_

_Week 14_ Class presentations

_Week 15_ Class presentations

_Week 16_ Class presentations /Field Trip

_Week 17_ Field Trip

**_Week 18_****Final Exam**

methodologies.note: Discussion through lectures and the class presentations
The labs will be weekly assignments
The case studies will be term papers required from each student.
